042/** This class is for the ADIS16470 IMU that connects to the RoboRIO SPI port. */
043@SuppressWarnings({
044  "unused",
045  "PMD.RedundantFieldInitializer",
046  "PMD.ImmutableField",
047  "PMD.SingularField",
048  "PMD.CollapsibleIfStatements",
049  "PMD.MissingOverride",
050  "PMD.EmptyIfStmt",
051  "PMD.EmptyStatementNotInLoop"
052})
053public class ADIS16470_IMU implements AutoCloseable, NTSendable {
054  /* ADIS16470 Register Map Declaration */
055  private static final int FLASH_CNT = 0x00; // Flash memory write count
056  private static final int DIAG_STAT = 0x02; // Diagnostic and operational status
057  private static final int X_GYRO_LOW = 0x04; // X-axis gyroscope output, lower word
058  private static final int X_GYRO_OUT = 0x06; // X-axis gyroscope output, upper word
059  private static final int Y_GYRO_LOW = 0x08; // Y-axis gyroscope output, lower word
060  private static final int Y_GYRO_OUT = 0x0A; // Y-axis gyroscope output, upper word
061  private static final int Z_GYRO_LOW = 0x0C; // Z-axis gyroscope output, lower word
062  private static final int Z_GYRO_OUT = 0x0E; // Z-axis gyroscope output, upper word
063  private static final int X_ACCL_LOW = 0x10; // X-axis accelerometer output, lower word
064  private static final int X_ACCL_OUT = 0x12; // X-axis accelerometer output, upper word
065  private static final int Y_ACCL_LOW = 0x14; // Y-axis accelerometer output, lower word
066  private static final int Y_ACCL_OUT = 0x16; // Y-axis accelerometer output, upper word
067  private static final int Z_ACCL_LOW = 0x18; // Z-axis accelerometer output, lower word
068  private static final int Z_ACCL_OUT = 0x1A; // Z-axis accelerometer output, upper word
069  private static final int TEMP_OUT = 0x1C; // Temperature output (internal, not calibrated)
070  private static final int TIME_STAMP = 0x1E; // PPS mode time stamp
071  private static final int X_DELTANG_LOW = 0x24; // X-axis delta angle output, lower word
072  private static final int X_DELTANG_OUT = 0x26; // X-axis delta angle output, upper word
073  private static final int Y_DELTANG_LOW = 0x28; // Y-axis delta angle output, lower word
074  private static final int Y_DELTANG_OUT = 0x2A; // Y-axis delta angle output, upper word
075  private static final int Z_DELTANG_LOW = 0x2C; // Z-axis delta angle output, lower word
076  private static final int Z_DELTANG_OUT = 0x2E; // Z-axis delta angle output, upper word
077  private static final int X_DELTVEL_LOW = 0x30; // X-axis delta velocity output, lower word
078  private static final int X_DELTVEL_OUT = 0x32; // X-axis delta velocity output, upper word
079  private static final int Y_DELTVEL_LOW = 0x34; // Y-axis delta velocity output, lower word
080  private static final int Y_DELTVEL_OUT = 0x36; // Y-axis delta velocity output, upper word
081  private static final int Z_DELTVEL_LOW = 0x38; // Z-axis delta velocity output, lower word
082  private static final int Z_DELTVEL_OUT = 0x3A; // Z-axis delta velocity output, upper word
083  private static final int XG_BIAS_LOW =
084      0x40; // X-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, lower word
085  private static final int XG_BIAS_HIGH =
086      0x42; // X-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, upper word
087  private static final int YG_BIAS_LOW =
088      0x44; // Y-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, lower word
089  private static final int YG_BIAS_HIGH =
090      0x46; // Y-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, upper word
091  private static final int ZG_BIAS_LOW =
092      0x48; // Z-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, lower word
093  private static final int ZG_BIAS_HIGH =
094      0x4A; // Z-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, upper word
095  private static final int XA_BIAS_LOW =
096      0x4C; // X-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, lower word
097  private static final int XA_BIAS_HIGH =
098      0x4E; // X-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, upper word
099  private static final int YA_BIAS_LOW =
100      0x50; // Y-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, lower word
101  private static final int YA_BIAS_HIGH =
102      0x52; // Y-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, upper word
103  private static final int ZA_BIAS_LOW =
104      0x54; // Z-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, lower word
105  private static final int ZA_BIAS_HIGH =
106      0x56; // Z-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, upper word
107  private static final int FILT_CTRL = 0x5C; // Filter control
108  private static final int MSC_CTRL = 0x60; // Miscellaneous control
109  private static final int UP_SCALE = 0x62; // Clock scale factor, PPS mode
110  private static final int DEC_RATE = 0x64; // Decimation rate control (output data rate)
111  private static final int NULL_CNFG = 0x66; // Auto-null configuration control
112  private static final int GLOB_CMD = 0x68; // Global commands
113  private static final int FIRM_REV = 0x6C; // Firmware revision
114  private static final int FIRM_DM = 0x6E; // Firmware revision date, month and day
115  private static final int FIRM_Y = 0x70; // Firmware revision date, year
116  private static final int PROD_ID = 0x72; // Product identification
117  private static final int SERIAL_NUM = 0x74; // Serial number (relative to assembly lot)
118  private static final int USER_SCR1 = 0x76; // User scratch register 1
119  private static final int USER_SCR2 = 0x78; // User scratch register 2
120  private static final int USER_SCR3 = 0x7A; // User scratch register 3
121  private static final int FLSHCNT_LOW = 0x7C; // Flash update count, lower word
122  private static final int FLSHCNT_HIGH = 0x7E; // Flash update count, upper word
123
124  private static final byte[] m_autospi_x_packet = {
125    X_DELTANG_OUT,
126    FLASH_CNT,
127    X_DELTANG_LOW,
128    FLASH_CNT,
129    X_GYRO_OUT,
130    FLASH_CNT,
131    Y_GYRO_OUT,
132    FLASH_CNT,
133    Z_GYRO_OUT,
134    FLASH_CNT,
135    X_ACCL_OUT,
136    FLASH_CNT,
137    Y_ACCL_OUT,
138    FLASH_CNT,
139    Z_ACCL_OUT,
140    FLASH_CNT
141  };
142
143  private static final byte[] m_autospi_y_packet = {
144    Y_DELTANG_OUT,
145    FLASH_CNT,
146    Y_DELTANG_LOW,
147    FLASH_CNT,
148    X_GYRO_OUT,
149    FLASH_CNT,
150    Y_GYRO_OUT,
151    FLASH_CNT,
152    Z_GYRO_OUT,
153    FLASH_CNT,
154    X_ACCL_OUT,
155    FLASH_CNT,
156    Y_ACCL_OUT,
157    FLASH_CNT,
158    Z_ACCL_OUT,
159    FLASH_CNT
160  };
161
162  private static final byte[] m_autospi_z_packet = {
163    Z_DELTANG_OUT,
164    FLASH_CNT,
165    Z_DELTANG_LOW,
166    FLASH_CNT,
167    X_GYRO_OUT,
168    FLASH_CNT,
169    Y_GYRO_OUT,
170    FLASH_CNT,
171    Z_GYRO_OUT,
172    FLASH_CNT,
173    X_ACCL_OUT,
174    FLASH_CNT,
175    Y_ACCL_OUT,
176    FLASH_CNT,
177    Z_ACCL_OUT,
178    FLASH_CNT
179  };
180
181  public enum CalibrationTime {
182    _32ms(0),
183    _64ms(1),
184    _128ms(2),
185    _256ms(3),
186    _512ms(4),
187    _1s(5),
188    _2s(6),
189    _4s(7),
190    _8s(8),
191    _16s(9),
192    _32s(10),
193    _64s(11);
194
195    private int value;
196
197    private CalibrationTime(int value) {
198      this.value = value;
199    }
200  }
201
202  public enum IMUAxis {
203    kX,
204    kY,
205    kZ
206  }
207
208  // Static Constants
209  private static final double delta_angle_sf = 2160.0 / 2147483648.0; /* 2160 / (2^31) */
210  private static final double rad_to_deg = 57.2957795;
211  private static final double deg_to_rad = 0.0174532;
212  private static final double grav = 9.81;
213
214  // User-specified yaw axis
215  private IMUAxis m_yaw_axis;
216
217  // Instant raw outputs
218  private double m_gyro_x = 0.0;
219  private double m_gyro_y = 0.0;
220  private double m_gyro_z = 0.0;
221  private double m_accel_x = 0.0;
222  private double m_accel_y = 0.0;
223  private double m_accel_z = 0.0;
224
225  // Integrated gyro angle
226  private double m_integ_angle = 0.0;
227
228  // Complementary filter variables
229  private double m_dt = 0.0;
230  private double m_alpha = 0.0;
231  private double m_tau = 1.0;
232  private double m_compAngleX = 0.0;
233  private double m_compAngleY = 0.0;
234  private double m_accelAngleX = 0.0;
235  private double m_accelAngleY = 0.0;
236
237  // State variables
238  private volatile boolean m_thread_active = false;
239  private int m_calibration_time = 0;
240  private volatile boolean m_first_run = true;
241  private volatile boolean m_thread_idle = false;
242  private boolean m_auto_configured = false;
243  private double m_scaled_sample_rate = 2500.0;
244
245  // Resources
246  private SPI m_spi;
247  private SPI.Port m_spi_port;
248  private DigitalInput m_auto_interrupt;
249  private DigitalOutput m_reset_out;
250  private DigitalInput m_reset_in;
251  private DigitalOutput m_status_led;
252  private Thread m_acquire_task;
253
254  private SimDevice m_simDevice;
255  private SimDouble m_simGyroAngleX;
256  private SimDouble m_simGyroAngleY;
257  private SimDouble m_simGyroAngleZ;
258  private SimDouble m_simAccelX;
259  private SimDouble m_simAccelY;
260  private SimDouble m_simAccelZ;
261
262  private static class AcquireTask implements Runnable {
263    private ADIS16470_IMU imu;
264
265    public AcquireTask(ADIS16470_IMU imu) {
266      this.imu = imu;
267    }
268
269    @Override
270    public void run() {
271      imu.acquire();
272    }
273  }
274
275  public ADIS16470_IMU() {
276    this(IMUAxis.kZ, SPI.Port.kOnboardCS0, CalibrationTime._4s);
277  }
278
279  /**
280   * @param yaw_axis The axis that measures the yaw
281   * @param port The SPI Port the gyro is plugged into
282   * @param cal_time Calibration time
283   */
284  public ADIS16470_IMU(IMUAxis yaw_axis, SPI.Port port, CalibrationTime cal_time) {
285    m_yaw_axis = yaw_axis;
286    m_calibration_time = cal_time.value;
287    m_spi_port = port;
288
289    m_acquire_task = new Thread(new AcquireTask(this));
290
291    m_simDevice = SimDevice.create("Gyro:ADIS16470", port.value);
292    if (m_simDevice != null) {
293      m_simGyroAngleX = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_angle_x", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
294      m_simGyroAngleY = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_angle_y", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
295      m_simGyroAngleZ = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_angle_z", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
296      m_simAccelX = m_simDevice.createDouble("accel_x", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
297      m_simAccelY = m_simDevice.createDouble("accel_y", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
298      m_simAccelZ = m_simDevice.createDouble("accel_z", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
299    }
300
301    if (m_simDevice == null) {
302      // Force the IMU reset pin to toggle on startup (doesn't require DS enable)
303      // Relies on the RIO hardware by default configuring an output as low
304      // and configuring an input as high Z. The 10k pull-up resistor internal to the
305      // IMU then forces the reset line high for normal operation.
306      m_reset_out = new DigitalOutput(27); // Drive SPI CS2 (IMU RST) low
307      Timer.delay(0.01); // Wait 10ms
308      m_reset_out.close();
309      m_reset_in = new DigitalInput(27); // Set SPI CS2 (IMU RST) high
310      Timer.delay(0.25); // Wait 250ms for reset to complete
311
312      if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
313        return;
314      }
315
316      // Set IMU internal decimation to 4 (output data rate of 2000 SPS / (4 + 1) =
317      // 400Hz)
318      writeRegister(DEC_RATE, 4);
319
320      // Set data ready polarity (HIGH = Good Data), Disable gSense Compensation and
321      // PoP
322      writeRegister(MSC_CTRL, 1);
323
324      // Configure IMU internal Bartlett filter
325      writeRegister(FILT_CTRL, 0);
326
327      // Configure continuous bias calibration time based on user setting
328      writeRegister(NULL_CNFG, (m_calibration_time | 0x0700));
329
330      // Notify DS that IMU calibration delay is active
331      DriverStation.reportWarning(
332          "ADIS16470 IMU Detected. Starting initial calibration delay.", false);
333
334      // Wait for samples to accumulate internal to the IMU (110% of user-defined
335      // time)
336      try {
337        Thread.sleep((long) (Math.pow(2.0, m_calibration_time) / 2000 * 64 * 1.1 * 1000));
338      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
339      }
340
341      // Write offset calibration command to IMU
342      writeRegister(GLOB_CMD, 0x0001);
343
344      // Configure and enable auto SPI
345      if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
346        return;
347      }
348
349      // Let the user know the IMU was initiallized successfully
350      DriverStation.reportWarning("ADIS16470 IMU Successfully Initialized!", false);
351
352      // Drive "Ready" LED low
353      m_status_led = new DigitalOutput(28); // Set SPI CS3 (IMU Ready LED) low
354    }
355
356    // Report usage and post data to DS
357    HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_ADIS16470, 0);
358  }
359
360  /**
361   * @param buf
362   * @return
363   */
364  private static int toUShort(ByteBuffer buf) {
365    return (buf.getShort(0)) & 0xFFFF;
366  }
367
368  /**
369   * @param sint
370   * @return
371   */
372  private static long toULong(int sint) {
373    return sint & 0x00000000FFFFFFFFL;
374  }
375
376  /**
377   * @param buf
378   * @return
379   */
380  private static int toShort(int... buf) {
381    return (short) (((buf[0] & 0xFF) << 8) + ((buf[1] & 0xFF) << 0));
382  }
383
384  /**
385   * @param buf
386   * @return
387   */
388  private static int toInt(int... buf) {
389    return (int)
390        ((buf[0] & 0xFF) << 24 | (buf[1] & 0xFF) << 16 | (buf[2] & 0xFF) << 8 | (buf[3] & 0xFF));
391  }
392
393  /**
394   * Switch to standard SPI mode.
395   *
396   * @return
397   */
398  private boolean switchToStandardSPI() {
399    // Check to see whether the acquire thread is active. If so, wait for it to stop
400    // producing data.
401    if (m_thread_active) {
402      m_thread_active = false;
403      while (!m_thread_idle) {
404        try {
405          Thread.sleep(10);
406        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
407        }
408      }
409      System.out.println("Paused the IMU processing thread successfully!");
410      // Maybe we're in auto SPI mode? If so, kill auto SPI, and then SPI.
411      if (m_spi != null && m_auto_configured) {
412        m_spi.stopAuto();
413        // We need to get rid of all the garbage left in the auto SPI buffer after
414        // stopping it.
415        // Sometimes data magically reappears, so we have to check the buffer size a
416        // couple of times
417        // to be sure we got it all. Yuck.
418        int[] trashBuffer = new int[200];
419        try {
420          Thread.sleep(100);
421        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
422        }
423        int data_count = m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(trashBuffer, 0, 0);
424        while (data_count > 0) {
425          m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(trashBuffer, Math.min(data_count, 200), 0);
426          data_count = m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(trashBuffer, 0, 0);
427        }
428        System.out.println("Paused auto SPI successfully.");
429      }
430    }
431    // There doesn't seem to be a SPI port active. Let's try to set one up
432    if (m_spi == null) {
433      System.out.println("Setting up a new SPI port.");
434      m_spi = new SPI(m_spi_port);
435      m_spi.setClockRate(2000000);
436      m_spi.setMSBFirst();
437      m_spi.setSampleDataOnTrailingEdge();
438      m_spi.setClockActiveLow();
439      m_spi.setChipSelectActiveLow();
440      readRegister(PROD_ID); // Dummy read
441
442      // Validate the product ID
443      if (readRegister(PROD_ID) != 16982) {
444        DriverStation.reportError("Could not find ADIS16470", false);
445        close();
446        return false;
447      }
448      return true;
449    } else {
450      // Maybe the SPI port is active, but not in auto SPI mode? Try to read the
451      // product ID.
452      readRegister(PROD_ID); // dummy read
453      if (readRegister(PROD_ID) != 16982) {
454        DriverStation.reportError("Could not find an ADIS16470", false);
455        close();
456        return false;
457      } else {
458        return true;
459      }
460    }
461  }
462
463  /** @return */
464  boolean switchToAutoSPI() {
465    // No SPI port has been set up. Go set one up first.
466    if (m_spi == null) {
467      if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
468        DriverStation.reportError("Failed to start/restart auto SPI", false);
469        return false;
470      }
471    }
472    // Only set up the interrupt if needed.
473    if (m_auto_interrupt == null) {
474      // Configure interrupt on SPI CS1
475      m_auto_interrupt = new DigitalInput(26);
476    }
477    // The auto SPI controller gets angry if you try to set up two instances on one
478    // bus.
479    if (!m_auto_configured) {
480      m_spi.initAuto(8200);
481      m_auto_configured = true;
482    }
483    // Do we need to change auto SPI settings?
484    switch (m_yaw_axis) {
485      case kX:
486        m_spi.setAutoTransmitData(m_autospi_x_packet, 2);
487        break;
488      case kY:
489        m_spi.setAutoTransmitData(m_autospi_y_packet, 2);
490        break;
491      default:
492        m_spi.setAutoTransmitData(m_autospi_z_packet, 2);
493        break;
494    }
495    // Configure auto stall time
496    m_spi.configureAutoStall(5, 1000, 1);
497    // Kick off auto SPI (Note: Device configration impossible after auto SPI is
498    // activated)
499    // DR High = Data good (data capture should be triggered on the rising edge)
500    m_spi.startAutoTrigger(m_auto_interrupt, true, false);
501
502    // Check to see if the acquire thread is running. If not, kick one off.
503    if (!m_acquire_task.isAlive()) {
504      m_first_run = true;
505      m_thread_active = true;
506      m_acquire_task.start();
507      System.out.println("Processing thread activated!");
508    } else {
509      // The thread was running, re-init run variables and start it up again.
510      m_first_run = true;
511      m_thread_active = true;
512      System.out.println("Processing thread activated!");
513    }
514    // Looks like the thread didn't start for some reason. Abort.
515    if (!m_acquire_task.isAlive()) {
516      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to start/restart the acquire() thread.", false);
517      close();
518      return false;
519    }
520    return true;
521  }
522
523  /**
524   * Configures calibration time
525   *
526   * @param new_cal_time New calibration time
527   * @return 1 if the new calibration time is the same as the current one else 0
528   */
529  public int configCalTime(CalibrationTime new_cal_time) {
530    if (m_calibration_time == new_cal_time.value) {
531      return 1;
532    }
533    if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
534      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure standard SPI.", false);
535      return 2;
536    }
537    m_calibration_time = new_cal_time.value;
538    writeRegister(NULL_CNFG, (m_calibration_time | 0x700));
539    if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
540      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure auto SPI.", false);
541      return 2;
542    }
543    return 0;
544  }
545
546  public int configDecRate(int reg) {
547    int m_reg = reg;
548    if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
549      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure standard SPI.", false);
550      return 2;
551    }
552    if (m_reg > 1999) {
553      DriverStation.reportError("Attemted to write an invalid deimation value.", false);
554      m_reg = 1999;
555    }
556    m_scaled_sample_rate = (((m_reg + 1.0) / 2000.0) * 1000000.0);
557    writeRegister(DEC_RATE, m_reg);
558    System.out.println("Decimation register: " + readRegister(DEC_RATE));
559    if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
560      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure auto SPI.", false);
561      return 2;
562    }
563    return 0;
564  }
565
566  /**
567   * Calibrate the gyro. It's important to make sure that the robot is not moving while the
568   * calibration is in progress, this is typically done when the robot is first turned on while it's
569   * sitting at rest before the match starts.
570   */
571  public void calibrate() {
572    if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
573      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure standard SPI.", false);
574    }
575    writeRegister(GLOB_CMD, 0x0001);
576    if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
577      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure auto SPI.", false);
578    }
579    ;
580  }
581
582  /**
583   * Sets the yaw axis
584   *
585   * @param yaw_axis The new yaw axis to use
586   * @return 1 if the new yaw axis is the same as the current one, 2 if the switch to Standard SPI
587   *     failed, else 0.
588   */
589  public int setYawAxis(IMUAxis yaw_axis) {
590    if (m_yaw_axis == yaw_axis) {
591      return 1;
592    }
593    if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
594      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure standard SPI.", false);
595      return 2;
596    }
597    m_yaw_axis = yaw_axis;
598    if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
599      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure auto SPI.", false);
600    }
601    return 0;
602  }
603
604  /**
605   * @param reg
606   * @return
607   */
608  private int readRegister(int reg) {
609    ByteBuffer buf = ByteBuffer.allocateDirect(2);
610    buf.order(ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN);
611    buf.put(0, (byte) (reg & 0x7f));
612    buf.put(1, (byte) 0);
613
614    m_spi.write(buf, 2);
615    m_spi.read(false, buf, 2);
616
617    return toUShort(buf);
618  }
619
620  /**
621   * @param reg
622   * @param val
623   */
624  private void writeRegister(int reg, int val) {
625    ByteBuffer buf = ByteBuffer.allocateDirect(2);
626    // low byte
627    buf.put(0, (byte) ((0x80 | reg)));
628    buf.put(1, (byte) (val & 0xff));
629    m_spi.write(buf, 2);
630    // high byte
631    buf.put(0, (byte) (0x81 | reg));
632    buf.put(1, (byte) (val >> 8));
633    m_spi.write(buf, 2);
634  }
635
636  /** {@inheritDoc} */
637  public void reset() {
638    synchronized (this) {
639      m_integ_angle = 0.0;
640    }
641  }
642
643  /** Delete (free) the spi port used for the IMU. */
644  @Override
645  public void close() {
646    if (m_thread_active) {
647      m_thread_active = false;
648      try {
649        if (m_acquire_task != null) {
650          m_acquire_task.join();
651          m_acquire_task = null;
652        }
653      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
654      }
655      if (m_spi != null) {
656        if (m_auto_configured) {
657          m_spi.stopAuto();
658        }
659        m_spi.close();
660        m_auto_configured = false;
661        if (m_auto_interrupt != null) {
662          m_auto_interrupt.close();
663          m_auto_interrupt = null;
664        }
665        m_spi = null;
666      }
667    }
668    System.out.println("Finished cleaning up after the IMU driver.");
669  }
670
671  /** */
672  private void acquire() {
673    // Set data packet length
674    final int dataset_len = 19; // 18 data points + timestamp
675    final int BUFFER_SIZE = 4000;
676
677    // Set up buffers and variables
678    int[] buffer = new int[BUFFER_SIZE];
679    int data_count = 0;
680    int data_remainder = 0;
681    int data_to_read = 0;
682    double previous_timestamp = 0.0;
683    double delta_angle = 0.0;
684    double gyro_x = 0.0;
685    double gyro_y = 0.0;
686    double gyro_z = 0.0;
687    double accel_x = 0.0;
688    double accel_y = 0.0;
689    double accel_z = 0.0;
690    double gyro_x_si = 0.0;
691    double gyro_y_si = 0.0;
692    double gyro_z_si = 0.0;
693    double accel_x_si = 0.0;
694    double accel_y_si = 0.0;
695    double accel_z_si = 0.0;
696    double compAngleX = 0.0;
697    double compAngleY = 0.0;
698    double accelAngleX = 0.0;
699    double accelAngleY = 0.0;
700
701    while (true) {
702      // Sleep loop for 10ms
703      try {
704        Thread.sleep(10);
705      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
706      }
707
708      if (m_thread_active) {
709        m_thread_idle = false;
710
711        data_count =
712            m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(
713                buffer, 0, 0); // Read number of bytes currently stored in the
714        // buffer
715        data_remainder =
716            data_count % dataset_len; // Check if frame is incomplete. Add 1 because of timestamp
717        data_to_read = data_count - data_remainder; // Remove incomplete data from read count
718        /* Want to cap the data to read in a single read at the buffer size */
719        if (data_to_read > BUFFER_SIZE) {
720          DriverStation.reportWarning(
721              "ADIS16470 data processing thread overrun has occurred!", false);
722          data_to_read = BUFFER_SIZE - (BUFFER_SIZE % dataset_len);
723        }
724        m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(
725            buffer, data_to_read, 0); // Read data from DMA buffer (only complete sets)
726
727        // Could be multiple data sets in the buffer. Handle each one.
728        for (int i = 0; i < data_to_read; i += dataset_len) {
729          // Timestamp is at buffer[i]
730          m_dt = ((double) buffer[i] - previous_timestamp) / 1000000.0;
731
732          /*
733           * System.out.println(((toInt(buffer[i + 3], buffer[i + 4], buffer[i + 5],
734           * buffer[i + 6]))*delta_angle_sf) / ((10000.0 / (buffer[i] -
735           * previous_timestamp)) / 100.0));
736           * // DEBUG: Plot Sub-Array Data in Terminal
737           * for (int j = 0; j < data_to_read; j++) {
738           * System.out.print(buffer[j]);
739           * System.out.print(" ,");
740           * }
741           * System.out.println(" ");
742           * //System.out.println(((toInt(buffer[i + 3], buffer[i + 4], buffer[i + 5],
743           * buffer[i + 6]))*delta_angle_sf) / ((10000.0 / (buffer[i] -
744           * previous_timestamp)) / 100.0) + "," + buffer[3] + "," + buffer[4] + "," +
745           * buffer[5] + "," + buffer[6]
746           * /*toShort(buffer[7], buffer[8]) + "," +
747           * toShort(buffer[9], buffer[10]) + "," +
748           * toShort(buffer[11], buffer[12]) + "," +
749           * toShort(buffer[13], buffer[14]) + "," +
750           * toShort(buffer[15], buffer[16]) + ","
751           * + toShort(buffer[17], buffer[18]));
752           */
753
754          /*
755           * Get delta angle value for selected yaw axis and scale by the elapsed time
756           * (based on timestamp)
757           */
758          delta_angle =
759              (toInt(buffer[i + 3], buffer[i + 4], buffer[i + 5], buffer[i + 6]) * delta_angle_sf)
760                  / (m_scaled_sample_rate / (buffer[i] - previous_timestamp));
761          gyro_x = (toShort(buffer[i + 7], buffer[i + 8]) / 10.0);
762          gyro_y = (toShort(buffer[i + 9], buffer[i + 10]) / 10.0);
763          gyro_z = (toShort(buffer[i + 11], buffer[i + 12]) / 10.0);
764          accel_x = (toShort(buffer[i + 13], buffer[i + 14]) / 800.0);
765          accel_y = (toShort(buffer[i + 15], buffer[i + 16]) / 800.0);
766          accel_z = (toShort(buffer[i + 17], buffer[i + 18]) / 800.0);
767
768          // Convert scaled sensor data to SI units (for tilt calculations)
769          // TODO: Should the unit outputs be selectable?
770          gyro_x_si = gyro_x * deg_to_rad;
771          gyro_y_si = gyro_y * deg_to_rad;
772          gyro_z_si = gyro_z * deg_to_rad;
773          accel_x_si = accel_x * grav;
774          accel_y_si = accel_y * grav;
775          accel_z_si = accel_z * grav;
776
777          // Store timestamp for next iteration
778          previous_timestamp = buffer[i];
779
780          m_alpha = m_tau / (m_tau + m_dt);
781
782          if (m_first_run) {
783            // Set up inclinometer calculations for first run
784            accelAngleX =
785                Math.atan2(
786                    accel_x_si, Math.sqrt((accel_y_si * accel_y_si) + (accel_z_si * accel_z_si)));
787            accelAngleY =
788                Math.atan2(
789                    accel_y_si, Math.sqrt((accel_x_si * accel_x_si) + (accel_z_si * accel_z_si)));
790            compAngleX = accelAngleX;
791            compAngleY = accelAngleY;
792          } else {
793            // Run inclinometer calculations
794            accelAngleX =
795                Math.atan2(
796                    accel_x_si, Math.sqrt((accel_y_si * accel_y_si) + (accel_z_si * accel_z_si)));
797            accelAngleY =
798                Math.atan2(
799                    accel_y_si, Math.sqrt((accel_x_si * accel_x_si) + (accel_z_si * accel_z_si)));
800            accelAngleX = formatAccelRange(accelAngleX, accel_z_si);
801            accelAngleY = formatAccelRange(accelAngleY, accel_z_si);
802            compAngleX = compFilterProcess(compAngleX, accelAngleX, -gyro_y_si);
803            compAngleY = compFilterProcess(compAngleY, accelAngleY, gyro_x_si);
804          }
805
806          synchronized (this) {
807            /* Push data to global variables */
808            if (m_first_run) {
809              /*
810               * Don't accumulate first run. previous_timestamp will be "very" old and the
811               * integration will end up way off
812               */
813              m_integ_angle = 0.0;
814            } else {
815              m_integ_angle += delta_angle;
816            }
817            m_gyro_x = gyro_x;
818            m_gyro_y = gyro_y;
819            m_gyro_z = gyro_z;
820            m_accel_x = accel_x;
821            m_accel_y = accel_y;
822            m_accel_z = accel_z;
823            m_compAngleX = compAngleX * rad_to_deg;
824            m_compAngleY = compAngleY * rad_to_deg;
825            m_accelAngleX = accelAngleX * rad_to_deg;
826            m_accelAngleY = accelAngleY * rad_to_deg;
827          }
828          m_first_run = false;
829        }
830      } else {
831        m_thread_idle = true;
832        data_count = 0;
833        data_remainder = 0;
834        data_to_read = 0;
835        previous_timestamp = 0.0;
836        delta_angle = 0.0;
837        gyro_x = 0.0;
838        gyro_y = 0.0;
839        gyro_z = 0.0;
840        accel_x = 0.0;
841        accel_y = 0.0;
842        accel_z = 0.0;
843        gyro_x_si = 0.0;
844        gyro_y_si = 0.0;
845        gyro_z_si = 0.0;
846        accel_x_si = 0.0;
847        accel_y_si = 0.0;
848        accel_z_si = 0.0;
849        compAngleX = 0.0;
850        compAngleY = 0.0;
851        accelAngleX = 0.0;
852        accelAngleY = 0.0;
853      }
854    }
855  }
856
857  /**
858   * @param compAngle
859   * @param accAngle
860   * @return
861   */
862  private double formatFastConverge(double compAngle, double accAngle) {
863    if (compAngle > accAngle + Math.PI) {
864      compAngle = compAngle - 2.0 * Math.PI;
865    } else if (accAngle > compAngle + Math.PI) {
866      compAngle = compAngle + 2.0 * Math.PI;
867    }
868    return compAngle;
869  }
870
871  /**
872   * @param compAngle
873   * @return
874   */
875  private double formatRange0to2PI(double compAngle) {
876    while (compAngle >= 2 * Math.PI) {
877      compAngle = compAngle - 2.0 * Math.PI;
878    }
879    while (compAngle < 0.0) {
880      compAngle = compAngle + 2.0 * Math.PI;
881    }
882    return compAngle;
883  }
884
885  /**
886   * @param accelAngle
887   * @param accelZ
888   * @return
889   */
890  private double formatAccelRange(double accelAngle, double accelZ) {
891    if (accelZ < 0.0) {
892      accelAngle = Math.PI - accelAngle;
893    } else if (accelZ > 0.0 && accelAngle < 0.0) {
894      accelAngle = 2.0 * Math.PI + accelAngle;
895    }
896    return accelAngle;
897  }
898
899  /**
900   * @param compAngle
901   * @param accelAngle
902   * @param omega
903   * @return
904   */
905  private double compFilterProcess(double compAngle, double accelAngle, double omega) {
906    compAngle = formatFastConverge(compAngle, accelAngle);
907    compAngle = m_alpha * (compAngle + omega * m_dt) + (1.0 - m_alpha) * accelAngle;
908    compAngle = formatRange0to2PI(compAngle);
909    if (compAngle > Math.PI) {
910      compAngle = compAngle - 2.0 * Math.PI;
911    }
912    return compAngle;
913  }
914
915  /** @return Yaw axis angle in degrees (CCW positive) */
916  public synchronized double getAngle() {
917    switch (m_yaw_axis) {
918      case kX:
919        if (m_simGyroAngleX != null) {
920          return m_simGyroAngleX.get();
921        }
922        break;
923      case kY:
924        if (m_simGyroAngleY != null) {
925          return m_simGyroAngleY.get();
926        }
927        break;
928      case kZ:
929        if (m_simGyroAngleZ != null) {
930          return m_simGyroAngleZ.get();
931        }
932        break;
933    }
934    return m_integ_angle;
935  }
936
937  /** @return Yaw Axis */
938  public IMUAxis getYawAxis() {
939    return m_yaw_axis;
940  }
941
942  /** @return current acceleration in the X axis */
943  public synchronized double getAccelX() {
944    return m_accel_x * 9.81;
945  }
946
947  /** @return current acceleration in the Y axis */
948  public synchronized double getAccelY() {
949    return m_accel_y * 9.81;
950  }
951
952  /** @return current acceleration in the Z axis */
953  public synchronized double getAccelZ() {
954    return m_accel_z * 9.81;
955  }
956
957  /** @return X axis complementary angle */
958  public synchronized double getXComplementaryAngle() {
959    return m_compAngleX;
960  }
961
962  /** @return Y axis complementary angle */
963  public synchronized double getYComplementaryAngle() {
964    return m_compAngleY;
965  }
966
967  /** @return X axis filtered acceleration angle */
968  public synchronized double getXFilteredAccelAngle() {
969    return m_accelAngleX;
970  }
971
972  /** @return Y axis filtered acceleration angle */
973  public synchronized double getYFilteredAccelAngle() {
974    return m_accelAngleY;
975  }
976
977  /**
978   * Get the SPI port number.
979   *
980   * @return The SPI port number.
981   */
982  public int getPort() {
983    return m_spi_port.value;
984  }
985
986  @Override
987  public void initSendable(NTSendableBuilder builder) {
988    builder.setSmartDashboardType("Gyro");
989    builder.addDoubleProperty("Value", this::getAngle, null);
990  }
991}
